did.unittitle: American Philosophical Society Archives. Record Group IIg
did.abstract:
This is part of the large inventory for the American Philosophical Society Archives. For complete information concerning this collection, please view the
Collection Description.

scopecontent.p: [Phila. A.L.S. on postal card 1p., end., and add Accepts Feb. 5, 1892, as date to read his paper, "Geometry and Mechanics Deny Evolution."]

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, L.S.: James G[illespie] Blaine. 1p., end. Enc. wanting. Sends note from French legation announcing Carlier bequest to A.P.S. For copy of note, see France. Legation. U.S. to J.G. Blaine, Dec. 8, 1891.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brunswick, Maine, A.L.S.: Geo. T. Little, Libn. 1p. Enc. wanting. Asks for exchange of publications. Sends list of Bowdoin publications.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: New York (N.Y.). Committee on Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of Washington, 1789

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Typed L.S.: Clarence W. Bowen, Secretary. 1p. Asks permission to photograph the Peale-Martin portrait of Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: N.Y., A.L.S.: A. Woodward, Librarian. 1p., end. and end. Concerns exchange of publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brunswick, Maine, A.L.S.: Geo[rge] T. Little [Librarian]. 1p., end., and end. Concerns its set of A.P.S. Proceedings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 1p., end., and end. Concerns his paper, "A Mythic Tale of the Isleta Indians." For printed paper, see: APS Proceedings, vol. 29, pp.208-218.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 1p. Concerns printing of his paper, "A Mythic Tale of Isleta." For printed paper, see: APS Proceedings. vol. 29, pp.208-218.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Secretary of the A.P.S.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: St. Paul, Minn., A.L.S. 4p. Inquires about maps in the Lewis and Clark diaries, in connection with his interest in historical geography of the North West.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Secretary of the A.P.S.;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S.: Thomas S. Fiske, Secy. 2p., end. Asks for copy of A.B. Taylor's paper on octonary numeration for Gustav Eneström of Stockholm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Phila.], Monday A.L.S. 1p., end., and end. Refers to his election as a Councillor of the A.P.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Phila.,] A.L.S. 1p., end. Concerns reading of his paper on "Possible Sterilization of City Water." For printed paper, see: A.P.S. Proceedings, Vol. 29, pp.26-39.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Mimeo. L. with MS. additions. 3p. Concerns his opinion on meteors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Phila.], Monday A.L.S. 3p. and end. Recommends Isidore Schwab for work in A.P.S. Library.
